title: The Veronicas' Jess and Lisa Origliasso thought it was a prank when removed from Qantas flight
text:
Jess and Lisa Origliasso have revealed that they thought they were the subject of a prank when they were removed from a Qantas flight last month.

Speaking to KIIS FM on Friday, Jess, 34, said: 'Because we did this thing with MTV, Lisa's like, "Maybe we're being Punk'd?"'

Lisa added: 'I genuinely thought we were being Punk'd'.

'Maybe we're being Punk'd?' The Veronicas' Jess and Lisa Origliasso (pictured) told KIIS FM on Friday that they thought they were the subject of a television prank when they were removed from Qantas flight last month

The pair were referring to the MTV show Punk'd, hosted by Ashton Kutcher, which involved elaborate pranks being pulled on celebrities.

However, the program was cancelled back in 2012, with a brief reboot in 2015.

'There wasn't an issue, that is what was so bizarre. There was no issue from our end!' Jess added of the plane incident.

Speaking to KIIS FM on Friday, Jess, 34, said: 'Because we did this thing with MTV, Lisa's like, 'Maybe we're being Punk'd?' Lisa added: 'I genuinely thought we were being Punk'd'. Pictured being removed from a Qantas flight in September

The singing sisters are currently filming their own MTV reality show, called Jess and Lisa: The Veronicas.

Last month, the stars claimed they were wrongly removed from a Qantas flight after asking a flight attendant for help adjusting their bags in the overhead compartment.

They said the flight attendant refused to help with their overhead luggage and Australian Federal Police officers were soon called onto the plane and had the sisters removed.

On TV: The singing sisters are currently filming their own MTV reality show, called Jess and Lisa: The Veronicas

'We actually already had our bag up in the overhead. The female flight attendant wanted Lisa's bag spun around,' they explained in a statement at the time.

'Lisa asked the attendant if she could help assist her because she couldn't reach it (we're only 5'1'). The attendant said it was against company policy.

'And a lovely man behind us helped instead.

Issue: Last month, the stars claimed they were wrongly removed from a Qantas flight after asking a flight attendant for help adjusting their bags in the overhead compartment

'Then right before take-off, the flight attendant brought over the manager and pointed us out. He proceeded to lecture us about company policy. We listened and asked for their names.'

The singers said staff refused to give their names and then announced they would be calling police to intervene.

Jess and Lisa have threatened legal action against the airline, and have urged fans to stand up for their rights when faced with similar situations.
description: Jess and Lisa Origliasso have revealed that they thought they were the subject of a prank when they were removed from a Qantas flight last month.
authors: Marta Jary For Daily Mail Australia
